4201.title: Entrance to the Crusader Keep
4201.description:
You stand at the only entrance to House Crusader.  The walls have been
carved from the solid earth by divine power.  Located deep underground,
it was constructed by Lord Julive after the original keep was destroyed.
However, as long as it lasted since then, it was no match for the wrath
of Lady Xyza who blasted it with her immortal magic after the gods of
this House attacked hers. The rest of the Keep, what is left of it, is
to the east. Druvka's ruined house is to the west.

west.description: You can head back into the ruined home of Druvka to the west.

4202.title: In the Keep
4202.description:
You are in the main hall of the keep.  There is a pit on the ground
here, for those that have just entered to give donation to the needy.
The stone walls are blackened and pitted, and the floor is littered
with rubble from what did not remain whole during the conflagration
of immortal magic which attacked this place.
To the north appears to be a barracks of some sort, and the main hall
continues to the south.

north.description: Sleeping quarters lie to the north.

west.description: The entrance to the keep is to the west.

4203.title: Crusader Barracks
4203.description:
Rows and rows of hard cots used to fill this room. Only one remains,
mostly in good shape. The others are twisted, burnt, not fit to sleep
upon.  To the south is the main hall of the keep.

east.description: A small bar lies to the east.

south.description: The main hall of the keep lies to the south.

4204.title: Main Hall
4204.description:
You are in the main hallway of the keep.  Torches in mangled sconces
line the blackened walls of this underground compound. The light flickers
on the walls, casting an eerie glow. Rubble on the floor makes walking
through a little dangerous.  It is relatively quiet here, except for the
passerby heading to or fro deeper within the compound.

north.description: The entryway and donation pit lie to the north.

east.description: You see a rectangular room to the east.

4205.title: The Chamber of Decisions
4205.description:
A long charred table passes through the center of the room. Its legs
are uneven, causing it to rock at the slightest touch. With a seating
capacity of 12, it requires the lower ranked Crusaders to stand. On
the blackened wall is a charred mural which covers most of the eastern
wall.  In the eastern corner of the north wall is a passage leading
further to the north.  Opposite it on the southern wall is a passage
leading to the south.  The Chamber of Decisions is where Crusaders come
to discuss problems and solve arguments.  In the middle of the table is
a large hole, charred and jagged, as though gouged by lightning.

south.description: The library is to the south.

west.description: The main hall heads back to the west.

extras.description:
The table is made of sturdy oak.  The chairs are also of oak and look
like most races could sit comfortably in them, if they were not charred
to a weakness, their legs ruined and uneven.

4206.title: Library of the Crusaders
4206.description:
Unfortunately, upon the destruction of the original keep, all of the
previous books and knowledge was lost from the world.  Currently, there
are only a few books on the spacious shelf.  This is a quiet room, and
sometimes Crusaders come here to just sit and meditate, in addition to
the usual reading. Amazingly enough, the destruction which seems to have
hit the rest of the Keep did not touch this room. You see not a charred
wall, not a charred bit of wood in the shelf. Near the entrances are
a few pieces of rubble from other ruined places within the Keep however.

north.description: A large rectangular room lies to the north.

extras.description:
A few books catch your eye.  They are titled "Beginning", "Recent History",
"Patience", "Ranks", "Banned" and "Battle.

The gnome Crusader, Druvka, offered his home to be the location of the
new Crusader Keep.  Combining the efforts of Lord Julive's divine power,
and the few gnomes that were willing to volunteer their services, the
new keep was constructed.

Since the rebuilding of the Crusader Keep, many things have happened.
Many who were impure and weak found ways to sneak within the ranks brought
much shame and disgrace upon the House. However, through the strong
leadership of Ripsaw, and then Nycholas, these members have been purged and
the Army shall once more rise to power and glory.
Following Nycholas' ascension to the heavens, Galad, then Korth, lead
the Crusades to much glory. All went well under the subsequent leadership of
Meldrad Ironwood, but then things degraded, and started to stagnate. Meldrad
faded into the mists, and the Keep was purged yet again.
Out of this purge, few Crusaders remained standing. One of these,
Gryleth, eventually led the Army of the Crusades. Under a newly refined
Code, more strict, but as well more honorable, the ranks of the Crusades
swelled, as did the honor of the Army. The purity of Thera was well on the
rise. During that time of prosperity for the Crusades, then Leader Gryleth
Shortleg had need to depart Thera for a short visit of a personal nature.
It was then that Xaithius stepped forth and lead the Crusades in Gryleth's
absence. Time passed and Gryleth returned. Upon his return, Xaithius quietly
retired and passed the position back to Gryleth. All seemed well. Suddenly,
and seemingly without warning, dishonor and treachery reared its ugly head.
Many fell to dishonor through selfish or prideful acts. To this day, the
names of the dishonored fallen are rarely spoken for fear of the same
happening again. Time passed and the wounded healed, and the glory of the
Crusades was again on the rise.
Houses rise and fall, leaders come and go, and the Crusades shall ever
remain pure and vigilant. Having lived many hundreds of years, most in
service to the Crusades, Gryleth Shortleg passed from his corporeal body and
ascended to the heavens. A call to arms was made for a replacement, and one
Kalibrak Tarrasque heeded that call. He most recently took up the mantle to
be that  Leader of the Crusades.
Only the Gods know what the future may bring....
(and in a beautiful runic hand, the following words: The forces of magic
and the wrath of the Rebel Goddess prevail over mortal weakness when the
exercise of body is overindulged and the exercise of spirit and mind are
ignored. It took your gods to weaken the magic in my Library, so I have
destroyed this foul anti-magic force which your gods graced you with, and
which for too long you have hidden behind.
---Lady Xyza, Rebel Goddess of Magic)

Since time and blood have proven only that magic is a force overwhelming in
its nature, it has been decreed that time and patience shall prove the
Crusade's mightiest ally.  With constant effort and wise leadership, the
Crusade shall grow in strength as Therans realize that magic is a thing best
left in divine hands, and that combat is the purist art form there is.
On the day when the day when all of Thera stands behind the Crusade, then
the final points of resistance shall be swept from Thera in a tide of steel!
(and in a beautiful runic hand the following was added: Constant effort
and wise leadership, two important aspects which your House sadly lacks.
---Lady Xyza, Rebel Goddess of Magic)

The ranking system of the great Army of the Crusade is as follows:
Daggers     - These are the lowest ranks, usually fairly new members.  The
Daggers often run errands for the higher-ranked members
of The Army, and are expected to offer their gear to naked
members that rank above them.
Broadswords - The Broadswords have proven themselves to be valuable members
of The Army through Valorous combat.  Most Crusaders are
at this rank, and they are expected to show unfailing
bravery in the face of any and all danger.
WarHammers  - Those Crusaders who time and time again prove themselves to be
Warriors of a truly exceptional caliber are often granted
the rank of WarHammer.  Much of the burden of raiding and
defense falls to the Warhammers, since they are adept at
all manners and styles of combat.
BattleAxes  - When a Warrior demonstrates prowess above and beyond his peers
in all things desired from a Crusader, he is granted the
title of BattleAxe.  Battleaxes are those who have found
true union with the spirit of battle, and understand the
spiritual nature of the hunt and the fight.
Warlord     - The Warlord of The Army is chosen from the ranks of the
BattleAxes, and is expected to lead The Army in matters
military.  In matters military, only the Leader can overrule
the word of the Warlord.
Envoy       - The Envoy is the political leader of The Army, and is
responsible for interviewing applicants and negotiating
with members of other Houses.  In matters political, only
the Leader can overrule the word of the Envoy.
Leader      - The Leader is the most elite member of The Army.  Chosen from
either the Warlords or the Envoy, the word of the Leader is
law for the rest of The Army.
(and in a beautiful runic hand at the bottom, you read:
Strong-Willed High-Ranked Non-Leader    - This one usurps the power of the
leadership and cows the leadership
into submission, reveling in the
ability to overrule the elders and
push his/her own agenda. May wind
up as a leader in his/her own right
after proving the incompetence of
current leadership. This one exists
only when the established leaders
are too weakminded to keep the
Army in line.)

The following items are specifically banned by the Crusade:
Any item with one or more of the following qualities:
Flaming Bite	Freezing Bite
Vampiric	Drowning
Wrath
Strange Girdle		Winged Sandals
Hands of Infernus	Ring of Chaos
(and in a beautiful runic hand below: Nice of the gods not to insist
that you use your common sense, if you have any, to determine what
else in the world is magical. As you refuse to think, you come closer
to being mine.
---Lady Xyza, Rebel Goddess of Magic)

A Crusader is an elite warrior and is expected to act with Valor and
Discipline.  Intent and action are judged independently when the Batle
Code is applied, so a Crusader is responsible both for their intent AND
the outcome of their actions.  Ignorance and errors are not acceptable
excuses.  Unless stated otherwise, the following rules apply to all
situations where a Crusader anticipates combat with another mortal soul.
BATTLE CODE OF THE CRUSADES
I.    A true Warrior must fight alone.  Do not group with or work with any
other when fighting, whether intentionally or incidentally.  This
means no bouncing a target between attackers.  There is NO excuse
for breaking this rule.
II.   The resources of the Crusade should focus on those who use sorcerous
We have no desire to alienate those who walk the line, rather we
would see them converted to the ways of purity.
III.  When attacking an enemy, a Crusader is to announce that target over
the House channel, This then means no other Crusader can touch that
target until:
A. The target dies.
B. The Crusader hunting dies, in which case the Crusader who
wishes to attack the killer/target must yell out that
target's name and alert them to vengeance in the name of
honor as well as making the House channel announcement.
C. The Crusader who first called the target announces over the
House channel that they no longer hunt the target and is
well out of the area of the target.  Those that wish to hunt
then announce the name over the House channel.
IV.   A mortal is considered one target. Only one Crusader may attack one
target at a time, no matter the number of pets, slaves, or soldiers
that target controls.  Any Crusader in range may attack those
creatures that follow the target in the interest of evening the odds
for the hunting Crusader as long as they DO NOT interfere with the
actual target.
V.    Under no circumstances should the followers of a Crusader (Ranger pets
or enlisted help) outnumber those of the target at the initiation of
a fight.  This applies equally to hunting, raiding, defending, and
duelling.  ANY ABUSE of this privilege will result in harsh
punishment and full revocation of this privilege.
VI.   Thieves and Monks of Crusaders are expected to have a higher honor
than others of their guild. This means before they use their stealthy
tactics (such as Blackjack, Backstab, Strangle and Assassinate) They
are to alert the opponent that they are being hunted.
VII.  When The Gauntlet is lost Crusaders are to offer a duel to those who
hold it, if refused they are to retrieve it.
VIII. If the item of another house is held within the Keep, a duel offered by
the enemy must be accepted (if fair) for a chance to regain it.  Any
Crusader within the range of the challenging party may be chosen as
the House's champion, it need not be the person asked to duel.
IX.   The rare exception that Crusaders can attack one or more mages
together is this: Only when the Gauntlet is lost and a duel not
accepted for it. Then The Crusaders may unite to retrieve it.  After
its return no such ganging is allowed.
X.    Those that take advantage of honor and repeatedly attack in groups or
with unfair numbers will be judged. The leaders will judge those that
forsake honor, and when approved by the Immortal leaders of the
Crusade the "Forsaken" will be added to a list. Those on this list
are without honor and shall not receive any any protection from it.
They can be killed in groups by Crusaders and stripped completely of
gear. ONLY THOSE ON THE FORSAKEN LIST MAY BE DEALT THIS WAY, ANY
CRUSADER ATTACKING THOSE WHO ARE NOT WILL BE PUNISHED.
XI.   Crusaders may not raid a house unless that house has a member to
defend (the member does not have to be in range, immortals do not
count).  Crusaders may also raid if the Gauntlet is missing and
believed to be in another house, if it is not that house is not to
be raided further.
XII.  Duels are matches or combat between two (2) people. Crusaders may
duel for honor, to test themselves, or to retrieve the Gauntlet.
A duel is suppose to be between two people solely, but a Crusader can
agree to handicap him/herself by allowing the rival to use slaves as
help. Also the duel can be to the death or until one loses the will
to go on and flees. The match can have equipment at stake or be merely
for challenge. Before a duel is fought a Crusader should do two
things, make sure the terms are clear and have the opponent give a
ready signal.  The opponent is to do likewise. In the event that you
duel for a House item, no trophy is to be taken, the corpse of the
loser is to be left untouched, and fallen weapons not taken. Only the
House item is at stake. The House item is to be handed to the enemy
if he/she is victorious, not sacrificed.
XIII. When an opponent falls to a Crusader, no more than 1/2 of his/her
possessions may be taken from his/her corpse.  This is for the
total looting, not just what the Crusader takes.  However, a Crusader
can keep 1 piece of equipment as a trophy of victory no matter what.
If someone else loots the corpse the crusader is to try to post a
scroll to the victim stating who if he knows and may only keep 1
piece of eq, returning the rest. Magical devices such as potions,
staves, wands, etc., are to be sacrificed to the gods. No Crusader
shall loot a wedding ring/band or a leader weapon or item from anyone,
to do so is to bring shame and the wrath of the gods upon oneself.

4207.title: The Final Defense
4207.description:
The walls in this room are reinforced by strong dwarvish steel, but this
steel was not strong enough to withstand the wrath of the Goddess of Magic.
A single torch hangs over the passage to the east, giving the room a darkened
appearance. The charred remains of something covering the mangled walls does
not lend any extra light.  Crusaders often use this as an ambush point to
subdue those raiding to steal the War Gauntlet.

west.description: You see the ruddy glow of a large forge.

4208.title: The Altar of the Never Ending Crusades
4208.description:
A simplistic granite block rests in the middle of the room here.  In
this block is housed the sacred War Gauntlet.  Only the Wise One is
allowed to touch its surface without divine retribution.  This room
of the Keep was also left unscathed by the Goddess's wrath, but there
is something changed about it, something very different indeed. Perhaps
it is the very light blue-greenish tint to everything. To the west,
the rest of the keep awaits.

west.description: You see a passage exiting to the west.

4209.title: The Crusader Bar
4209.description:
Broken bottles, a twisted and mangled bar, charred stools: This was once
a place for Crusaders to come and relax and talk about battles, but there
is nowhere to relax in this mess now. You see no sign of the barkeep either.
Did he get away with some of his stock of drinks? Did he get away at all?
You see no sign of his having died here...

west.description: The barracks lie to the west.

4210.title: The Smithy of the Crusades
4210.description:
You might think that the extreme heat of the huge forge and the vats of
molten steel could withstand the wrath of the Goddess, but instead you
note that the fires are out, and the vat solid rock. Indeed, the walls
are cracked, as though struck with extreme cold. The forge itself is
cracked. Rubble is strewn everywhere on the ground. You touch a metal
blade on the floor, it shatters, weakened by a force unknown to mortals.

east.description: A large steel archway leads to the Final Defense.
